member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.Resources.NotInsideTest_Error_Template
P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.Resources.ParallelRunning_Error
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to dotMemory Unit does not support parallel testing as the objects created in one test may impact assertions in another. Disable parallel testing in your unit test runner..

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.Resources.QuerySet_Exception
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to One of query is null.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.Resources.RunNotUnderDmu_Exception_Template
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The test was run without the support for dotMemory Unit. To safely run tests with or without (depending on your needs) the support for dotMemory Unit: - Set '{0}' to '{1}'. In this case, if a test is run without the support for dotMemory Unit, all '{2}' calls will be ignored. - If you use the '{3}' class to work with memory, wrap all dotMemoryApi calls that get data for assertions with the '{4}' check. .

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.Resources.TestOutput_Prefix
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to [dotMemory Unit]: .

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.Resources.TypeProperty_NotTypeException
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to TypeProperty supports only instantiable and open generic types. Interfaces and abstract types are NOT supported.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.Resources.xUnitOutput_Exception_Template
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to xUnit does not capture the standard output stream which is used by dotMemory Unit to report issues and save workspaces. Use {0} to link dotMemory Unit with xUnit ITestOutputHelper or suppress this exception by applying {1} to the assembly. Suppressing the exception does not prevent dotMemory Unit from saving profiling data.

member.name: T:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.DotMemoryUnitController
member.summary: If the unit testing framework you use is not supported by dotMemory Unit out of the box, you can use the DotMemoryController class as a workaround. All you need to do is to tell dotMemory Unit where your test method starts and where it ends.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.DotMemoryUnitController.TestStart(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Indicates the start of a test.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.DotMemoryUnitController.TestFailed(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Indicates test failure.
member.param: Indicates whether the test failed on memory assertion or due to another reason.
member.remarks: Usage of this method with == false is required only if you use the = option.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.DotMemoryUnitController.TestEnd
member.summary: Indicates the end of a test. Ensure this method is called even if exception is thrown from test.

member.name: T:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.EnableDotMemoryUnitSupportAttribute
member.summary: Use this attribute to mark an assembly with test methods in case the assembly does not use dotMemory Unit itself but calls the code from other assemblies that do use dotMemory Unit.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Kernel.dotMemoryApi.GetSnapshot
member.summary: Gets a memory snapshot. See the method for details.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Kernel.dotMemoryApi.GetDifference(JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Kernel.Snapshot,JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Kernel.Snapshot)
member.summary: Gets difference between two snapshots. The result contains data about objects that were allocated and collected in the timeframe between getting the snapshots.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Kernel.dotMemoryApi.GetTrafficBetween(JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Kernel.Snapshot,JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Kernel.Snapshot)
member.summary: Gets data about memory traffic in the timeframe between getting the snapshots.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Kernel.dotMemoryApi.SaveCollectedData(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the workspace containing all memory snapshots collected during unit test run to the specified directory. Use the attribute if you want dotMemory Unit to automatically save workspaces. To view the collected snapshots, open the workspace in the standalone dotMemory profiler using the Home | Import Workspace menu.
member.param: Path to the directory where workspace files must be saved. This can be either a full path or a path relative to the profiled assembly where test method is declared. For simplicity, you can use a number of constants to build paths to special system folders, e.g., "{LocalAppData}\Snapshots". See the full list of constants in class.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Kernel.dotMemoryApi.IsEnabled
member.summary: Checks whether a test is run under dotMemory Unit. Use it before calling the assert statements. However, we recommend that you use method for assertions.
member.remarks: However, we recommend that you use the method for this purpose.

member.summary: Creates a query to get a subset of objects that matches the passed query.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Controller.TestController.TestStart
member.summary: Do not call this method from your code. It is used by profiler core and manual call will broke state machine.

member.summary: Do not call this method from your code. It is used by profiler core and manual call will broke state machine.

member.summary: Do not call this method from your code. It is used by profiler core and manual call will broke state machine.

member.summary: Creates a query to get memory traffic data for objects that match the passed query.

member.name: T:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.SnapshotDifference
member.summary: Representes a difference between two memory snapshots.

member.summary: Gets a set of new objects - the ones that were created and not collected in the timeframe between getting the snapshots.
member.param: Query for getting a set of objects by a specific condition.

member.summary: Gets a set of dead objects - the ones that were collected in the timeframe between getting the snapshots.
member.param: Query for getting a set of objects by a specific condition.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.SnapshotDifference.GetSurvivedObjects(System.Func{JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.ObjectProperty,JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Client.Interface.Query})
member.summary: Gets a set of survived objects - the ones that were created before getting the base snapshot and not collected in the timeframe between getting the snapshots.
member.param: Query for getting a set of objects by a specific condition.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.SnapshotDifference.GetSurvivedObjects(JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Origin,System.Func{JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.ObjectProperty,JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Client.Interface.Query})
member.summary: Gets a set of survived objects - the ones that were created before getting the base snapshot and not collected in the timeframe between getting the snapshots.
member.param: Specifies whether the newer or older snapshot should be used to get data about survived objects.
Query for getting a set of objects by a specific condition.

member.name: T:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.AssertTrafficAttribute
member.summary: Allows you to assert that a test allocates less than a specific number of objects or memory amount. Apply it to test method.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.AssertTrafficAttribute.AllocatedSizeInBytes
member.summary: Asserts the size of allocated objects in bytes.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.AssertTrafficAttribute.AllocatedObjectsCount
member.summary: Asserts the number of allocated objects.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.AssertTrafficAttribute.Types
member.summary: Allows selecting objects by type.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.AssertTrafficAttribute.Interfaces
member.summary: Allows selecting objects by implemented interface.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.AssertTrafficAttribute.Namespaces
member.summary: Allows selecting objects by namespace.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.dotMemory.Check
member.summary: Gets a reference memory in this execution point. This point can be used to get difference and memory traffic with method Gets a reference to memory data in the current execution point. Use this reference as a base for comparison with memory data taken in other points. For example, you can get data about objects that were allocated / collected between two points. See the method for details.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.dotMemory.Check(System.Action{JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Memory})
member.summary: Gets a reference to memory data in the current execution point and checks these data using assert statements. An assertion must be passed to the method in a lambda expression. By default, if the assertion fails, dotMemory Unit will auto-save the workspace with all collected snapshots. Use this workspace to analyze why the test fails. Use to change the default auto-save behavior.
member.param: Lambda expression that is called if the test is run under dotMemory Unit.
member.returns: Returns a reference to memory data in the current execution point. Use this reference to compare memory data with the data taken in other points using the method. For example, you can get data about objects that were allocated / collected between two points.

member.name: T:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Memory
member.summary: Represents a reference to memory data at some execution point.

member.name: T:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Kernel.Snapshot
member.summary: Represents a memory snapshot. This is a low-level implementation of the type.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Memory.GetDifference(JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.MemoryCheckPoint)
member.summary: Gets difference between this memory snapshot and the snapshot passed in .
member.returns: Returns an instance of the SnapshotDifference type that allows you to get data about new, dead, and survived objects.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Memory.GetTrafficFrom(JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.MemoryCheckPoint)
member.summary: Gets data about memory traffic in the timeframe between this memory snapshot and the snapshot passed in .
member.returns: Returns an instance of the Traffic type that allows you to get data about objects that were allocated and collected during the specified timeframe.

member.name: T:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.MemoryCheckPoint
member.summary: Represents a reference to memory data in some execution point. Use this reference to get data about objects in memory, compare it with data taken in another execution point, get traffic data between two execution points. For all these purposes, use the method.

member.name: T:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.QueryBuilder
member.summary: Allows creating and reusing queries.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.QueryBuilder.GetObjects(System.Func{JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.ObjectProperty,JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Client.Interface.Query})
member.summary: Create a query to get a subset of objects that matches the passed query.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.QueryBuilder.TrafficQuery(System.Func{JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.TrafficProperty,JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Client.Interface.Query})
member.summary: Creates a query to get memory traffic data for objects that match the passed query.

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.QueryBuilder.CreateTrafficQuery(System.Int32,System.Int32,JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.AssertTrafficAttribute)
member.summary: Remove it when break compatibility

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.DotMemoryUnitAttribute.SavingStrategy
member.summary: Sets workspace auto-save conditions. See for details. The default value is

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.DotMemoryUnitAttribute.WorkspaceNumberLimit
member.summary: Maximum number of workspaces that can be saved upon test failures. The default value is 5.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.DotMemoryUnitAttribute.DiskSpaceLimit
member.summary: Maximum disk size in bytes that can be used for storing workspaces. The default value is 200 MB. If is greater than 0, the first saved workspace wich exceed this limit will be saved.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.DotMemoryUnitAttribute.Directory
member.summary: Path to the directory where workspace files must be saved. This can be either a full path or a path relative to the profiled assembly where test method is declared. For simplicity, you can use a number of constants to build paths to special system folders, e.g., "{LocalAppData}\Snapshots". See the full list of constants in class.
member.remarks: To view the collected snapshots, open the workspace in the standalone dotMemory profiler using the Home | Import Workspace menu.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.DotMemoryUnitAttribute.CollectAllocations
member.summary: Specifies whether the memory allocation data (creation stack trace and memory traffic data) must be collected or not within a certain scope. To specify the scope (an assembly, a class, or a method), mark the desired assembly, class, or method with this attribute. Collecting memory allocation data significantly increases the profiling overhead. Use it only if you need to measure the amount of memory traffic. Note that enables collecting allocations in the marked method automatically. You do not need to set the to true in this case.

member.name: P:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.DotMemoryUnitAttribute.FailIfRunWithoutSupport
member.summary: Specifies whether the call will throw an exception or ignore passed lambda if the tests are run without the support for dotMemory Unit. Default value is true.

member.name: T:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Client.Interface.QueryExpression
member.summary: QueryExpression is applied to an object set in order to get a subset of objects Inherits Query is used just for syntax sugar reasons, this is not "is a" inheritance

member.name: F:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.Generation.Gen1
member.summary: Garbage collector generation 1

member.name: F:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.Generation.Gen2
member.summary: Garbage collector generation 2

member.name: F:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Properties.Generation.LOH
member.summary: Large Object Heap

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Client.Interface.IDotMemoryUnit.SetTestFailed
member.summary: Should not throw any exception due to it is called from 'catch' block

member.name: M:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Client.Interface.IDotMemoryUnit.SetTestFailedOnMemoryAssert
member.summary: Should not throw any exception due to it is called from 'catch' block

member.name: T:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.Origin
member.summary: Specifies whether the newer or older snapshot should be used to get data about survived objects. This is required as survived objects exist in both newer and older snapshots.

member.name: F:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.SavingStrategy.OnCheckFail
member.summary: Save workspaces only if the test fails on assertion passed into the guarded method.

member.name: F:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.SavingStrategy.OnAnyFail
member.summary: Save workspaces in case of any test failure.

member.name: F:JetBrains.dotMemoryUnit.SavingStrategy.Never
member.summary: Do not save workspaces.

member.summary: Data on collected objects: objects count and total size.

summary.para: Gets the real runtime size for instances of the specified type, the same size that applies to array elements as they sum up to the array size. Works for intrinsic types, value types, reference types, whatever.
Uses the sizeof CIL instruction to get the actual size. Note that C#'s sizeof() does not work for all types, and gets the marshalling size, which is a 4x error for a boolean.

Gets the real runtime size for instances of the specified type, the same size that applies to array elements as they sum up to the array size. Works for intrinsic types, value types, reference types, whatever.
Uses the sizeof CIL instruction to get the actual size. Note that C#'s sizeof() does not work for all types, and gets the marshalling size, which is a 4x error for a boolean.
